title.value: Onion yield depending on date and planting density of sets
Урожайность лука репчатого в зависимости от сроков и густоты посадки севка

journal.title: Vegetable Growing : collection of scientific papers

person.name: Aksenyuk, A.R., National Academy of Sciences, Minsk (Belarus). Institute for Vegetable Growing

abstract.value: In the conditions of the Republic of Belarus there were presented the research results of influence of sowing date of bulb onion (Allium сера) on its yielding capacity. Besides, there were data of comparative estimation of methods of planting and optimization of planting density for local varieties Dyjament and Krivicki ruzovy. The studies have shown the advantage of planting onion in the period from May 1 to 5. When planting onion during the mentioned period the yield of onion varieties Dyjament was 44-42,3 t / ha and variety Krivicki ruzovy - 38,8-36,7 t / ha. Delay in planting for every 5 days led to yield lowering in both varieties on 4,0-9,2% and 5,7-10,2%. Comparative analysis of different ways of onion planting revealed that the highest yield of onion varieties Dyjament and Krivicki ruzovy respectively was 42.1 and 40.4 t / ha was obtained by hand-planting in two lines of the scheme (62 8) x 10 cm (plant density 286 thousand pieces / ha). Hand planting of onion in one line yielded onion harvest varieties Dyjament - 34.1 t / ha and Krivicki ruzovy - 31.5 t / ha, respectively, 8.0 and 8.9 t / ha lower than when in two-row planting.
